modules.description: Converts a 3D axis object into a Python object, enabling interaction with Python-based plotting libraries. Works with 3D axis data structures from the Matplotlib module. Useful for embedding OCaml-generated 3D plots into Python workflows or extending plots using Python code.

Converts a Matplotlib axis object into a Python object, enabling direct interaction with Python-based plotting libraries. Works with Matplotlib axis handles and Python object types. Useful for extending or customizing plots using Python APIs directly from OCaml.

Converts a Matplotlib figure object into a Python object, enabling direct interaction with Python-based plotting libraries. Works specifically with `Matplotlib.Fig.t` types, which represent figures in the Matplotlib library. This function is useful when integrating OCaml-generated plots into Python workflows or when extending plots using Python-specific features.

This module creates and customizes 2D plots and visualizations using arrays of numerical data. It supports line plots, histograms, scatter plots, and image displays, with control over axes limits, labels, grid lines, and legends. Use it to visualize mathematical functions, statistical distributions, or experimental data directly in OCaml applications.

This module configures and manipulates 2D plot axes, supporting operations like setting titles, axis limits, labels, aspect ratios, and grid visibility. It works with axis objects, numerical arrays, and plotting parameters such as colors, labels, and line styles. Concrete use cases include creating line plots, histograms, scatter plots, and image displays with customized visual properties and layout settings.

Handles figure creation and management for plotting, supporting operations like adding subplots (2D and 3D), creating figures with one or two axes arranged horizontally or vertically, and setting figure-wide titles. Works directly with figure and axis types to build complex visualizations. Useful for generating multi-panel plots and integrating with Python plotting workflows through the Expert module.

This module configures 3D axes for plots, supporting operations like setting axis limits, labels, titles, and grid visibility. It works with 3D axis objects and supports rendering scatter plots and image data. Concrete use cases include visualizing 3D datasets, customizing plot appearance, and integrating with Python plotting workflows through the Expert submodule.

This module provides tools for creating and customizing 2D and 3D visualizations, including line plots, scatter plots, histograms, and image displays. It operates on numerical arrays and axis/figure objects to control plot appearance, layout, and data rendering. Concrete use cases include visualizing mathematical functions, statistical data, and multi-panel figures with precise control over axes, labels, and layout.
